Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fragmentary WG lekythos. Achilles Painter (Hornbostel). Third quarter fifth. 445-435 (Oakley).
Record.CAVI-Subject: Woman to right (upper portion missing); part of a woman seated to left on a chair and holding a plemochoe; above her, on top, an oinochoe hung up, and, to right, a sash hung up. — C] Between the women, below the top margin, remains of a horizontal tabella, no doubt a stoich. three-liner, centered where possible: [Αξιοπ]ειθης | [καλος] | [Αλκιμαχ]ο. /////..... ///// ///////{1}. C] [Αξιοπ]ειθης.
Record.CAVI-Comments: Ex Helgoland, Kropatscheck. Ionic alphabet. - The inscription preserves part of the top line of a regular three-line tabella and apparently the final o of the father's name.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} lines 1 and 3 are rather closer than one would expect. There may be a trace of the pi in line 1.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: BADB 6394. — Hornbostel (1977), 327/279. — Hornbostel (1980), 135-36/78. — M&M-Auction (1983), 25/54, pl. (quite cl.) [[and SEG 33.64l]]. — Add.[2] (1989), 393. — Oakley (1997), 145/228, pl. 120A-B (show inscription in part [[in fact, all remaining parts, cl.]]).

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Frs. of WG lekythos. From Athens, Agora. Pasiades. Last quarter sixth. Ca. 510.
Record.CAVI-Subject: A youth and a woman remain.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: On the shoulder (frs. a and d), Gr. on a wide BG band: Πασιαδ[ες] and εγραφ[σεν]{1}. Fr. b: before the youth's head, in BG: κα̣[--], retr.{2}. Fragment c: between the woman's back and back of chair, retr.: [κ]αλ̣[--].
Record.CAVI-Comments: Frs. a - d. - The name Pasiades recurs, with εποιεσεν, on three WG alabastra, ARV[2] 102,2-4, q.v. for attribution. Alpha is very variable.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} there may be a stroke before the epsilon: μ̣εγραφ[σεν](?). {2} a diagonal line remains: κ/[--].

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fragmentary WG lekythos. From Athens. Unattributed. Second quarter fifth. Ca. 460.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: To right of the mistress' face, stoich. left-aligned three-liner: Γλαυκο̣ν̣ | καλος̣ | Λεαγ̣ρο.
Record.CAVI-Comments: Second white used. The surface is flaky and the inscription is hard to read from the photos. Probably mixed alphabet (near-Ionic). In particular, the o of Glaukon and the sigma are not well preserved.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: Bosanquet (1896), pl. 4. — A. Greifenhagen, CVA Bonn 1, Germany 1 (1938), pl. 41,1. — ARV[2] (1963), 1582/23. — AttScr (1990), no. 688.
